meanings.definition: A card or signal used in lean manufacturing to regulate the flow of work.
meanings.sent1: The workers moved the kanbans to indicate the next task.
meanings.sent2: In the factory, the kanbans helped organize the production line.
meanings.sent3: The kanbans played a game of directing the workers around the factory.
meanings.sent4: The kanbans acted as traffic lights for the workflow.
meanings.sent5: The colorful kanbans made the process easy to follow.

meanings.definition: A system of visual signals used in lean manufacturing to manage inventory levels.
meanings.sent1: The kanbans on the shelves showed when to restock.
meanings.sent2: The company used kanbans to keep track of their supplies.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kanbans rearranged themselves on the inventory board.
meanings.sent4: The kanbans were like flags waving to indicate low stock.
meanings.sent5: The kanbans system prevented overstocking issues.

meanings.definition: A method of production control in lean manufacturing that uses visual cues to trigger action.
meanings.sent1: The kanbans system helped the team stay organized.
meanings.sent2: Kanbans were essential for the smooth operation of the assembly line.
meanings.sent3: The kanbans whispered instructions to the workers as they passed by.
meanings.sent4: The kanbans were like magic spells that kept the production flowing.
meanings.sent5: The bright kanbans caught the workers' attention instantly.
